TEXT: The applicants are NORP nationals , born in DATE respectively . They are a married couple and live in GPE , GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the applicants bought for cash CARDINAL shares in a joint stock company ( spółka akcyjna ) “ C ” . On CARDINAL DATE the shareholders of the company decided that the share capital would be increased to MONEY ( PLZ ) and approved a private placement of a new issue of shares . On CARDINAL DATE the applicants signed before a notary a deed in which they agreed to acquire CARDINAL shares in the “ C ” company in exchange for a contribution in kind . Their contribution consisted of an industrial estate situated in LOC . On DATE the company was registered as the owner of the property in the ORG real property register ( Sąd Rejonowy Wydział Ksiąg Wieczystych ) .

On DATE the second applicant joined the company management board . Subsequently , he became unhappy with certain decisions of other company directors . As a result , on DATE the applicants requested the company that their contribution in kind be returned to them .
On DATE ORG allowed the company ’s request and registered in the commercial register an increase in the share capital to PLZ CARDINAL .

On DATE the shareholders of the company adopted a resolution obliging the management board to conclude an agreement under which the property contributed by the applicants would be transferred back to them and they would return the company shares . At the same time , the shareholders approved the second applicant ’s resignation from the board . Subsequently , the applicants requested the prosecution service to initiate criminal proceedings against certain members of the management board . In addition , they were involved in court proceedings concerning the property record in a real property register and bankruptcy proceedings relating to the “ C ” company .

On DATE the applicants lodged with ORG an application under LAW of LAW . They requested the court to strike out CARDINAL entries in the commercial register concerning the “ C ” company . The first contested entry stated that the share capital of the company amounted to PLZ CARDINAL . The second entry confirmed changes in the company by - laws . The applicants claimed that the entries had been based on untrue statements and inaccurate information and had been inadmissible in law .
On DATE the court held a hearing and took evidence from the parties .

On DATE the applicants complained to ORG ( Sąd Najwyższy ) about the inactivity of ORG . They claimed that the proceedings in their case disclosed unreasonable delay even though their request could have been decided at the first hearing .
On DATE ORG notified the President of ORG that the above complaint had been lodged and instructed the court of first instance to take further action in respect of it .

On DATE ORG held a hearing during which it allowed the applicants ' request of DATE . In particular , the court struck out CARDINAL entries in the commercial register concerning an increase of the share capital and amendments of the by - laws . The court also ordered the management board that the amendments to the company by - laws be made to ensure their compliance with domestic legislation . In addition , it instructed the board to take several other measures required by LAW in relation to the increase in the share capital .

The DATE LAW provides that a joint - stock company should be registered in the ORG commercial register . The ORG contains records concerning inter alia a company name , registered office , business , officers , share capital , number of shares and contributions . A company is required to notify within DATE any changes in the records .
Section CARDINAL of the Commercial Code , insofar as relevant , provides :

" CARDINAL . ( ... ) where an application is made to rectify or strike an entry out of the commercial register on the grounds that it is unjustified , the court may order that a warning ( wzmianka ) [ about the application ] be made in the register . ( … ) ”
